meanings.definition: Priced too high; costing more than it is worth.
meanings.sent1: The toy was overpriced, so I decided not to buy it.
meanings.sent2: The overpriced dress was way too expensive for my budget.
meanings.sent3: The overpriced ice cream better taste like gold for that price!
meanings.sent4: The overpriced concert tickets felt like they were made of diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The overpriced car seemed to sparkle with luxury, but it was just too costly.

meanings.definition: To set a price that is too high.
meanings.sent1: The store owner tends to overprice his products, which drives customers away.
meanings.sent2: I hope they don't overprice the new video game; I really want to buy it.
meanings.sent3: If you overprice your lemonade stand drinks, no one will buy them!
meanings.sent4: She tends to overprice her artwork, thinking it's worth more than it is.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to overprice their services, leading to a drop in sales.
